(looking at Wilmore and Carpenter) I know what this guy is about-- greed--he's in and out for the buck and he don't take prisoners. He don't give a damn about Northstar or us ...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now, wait a minute, Dad...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sure. What's worth doing is worth doing for money. It's a bad bargain where nobody gains. And if this deal goes through, we all gain. Carl throws down his napkin, rises from the chair, looks at the others.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: 'Course my son did work three summers as a baggage handler and freight loader. With those qualifications, why should I doubt his ability to run an airline? There is frozen silence at the table.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fine, if you don't want us, stay with the scum in present management--dedicated to running you and Bluestar into the ground.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...that "scum" built this company up from one plane in thirty years, they made something out of nothing, and if that's a scum I'll take one over a rat any day... Carl turns and leaves. Bud glances at Gekko, reading his piercing look. He hurries after his father.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bud catches up to Carl, waiting for the elevator, hammering him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Congratulations. You did a great job of embarrassing me in there-- not to mention yourself! Save the "workers of the world unite" speech for next time Dad, I heard it too much growing up. You're gonna get axed Dad, no two ways about it, you and the whole airline are going down the tubes, you hear me, just like Braniff, you don't have a chance in hell, and if it isn't Gekko it's gonna be some other killer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Carl steps into the elevator, Bud follows.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's got your prick in his back pocket, son, and you're standing naked in the display window of Macy's. He's using you. Only you're too blind to see it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, what I see is a jealous old machinist who can't stand that his son's become more successful than himself.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What you see, son, is a man who never measured success by the size of a man's wallet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's because you never had the guts to go out into the world and stake your claim.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Boy, if that's what you think, I must've really screwed up my job as a father.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bud and Carl exit the elevator and head across the luxury lobby.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...as far as being axed, I'm still here and as long as I am, I have a responsibility not just to me but to the union members I represent...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your responsibility, Dad, is to present the facts, not your opinions, to the men... you're gonna destroy their lives, Dad! Don't do it to 'em. Give it a chance. Let the membership decide for themselves, Dad. Please.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll be damned that when my men come to me tomorrow morning, wanting to know what's going on, I'm going to lie to them!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your men! All my life "your men" have been able to count on you? Why is it that you've never been there for me? They head through the doors, out onto the street.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bud following Carl.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And what if you're wrong? What if one day, the sun didn't rise in the East and birds didn't fly South in winter and for once in your life your compass was off? Huh? He grabs Carl by the arm, stopping him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Would you be willing to wreck your men's future? My future? Please... Dad. Think. Be practical, for a change. I'm asking you, I'm fucking begging you... Bud lets go of Carl's arm. Carl looks at his son, seeing the desperation. Sadness and confusion take hold of him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't sleep with no whore and I don't wake up with no whore. That's how I live with myself, Buddy. I don't know how you do. (a beat) I hope I'm wrong, I'll let them decide for themselves, that much I promise you. He walks away. Bud watches him go, knows he has won.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bud, increasingly frazzled and determined, dark circles under his eyes paces with the phone...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mr. Dixon Brandt on 3...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's up Dixon? (stopping, focusing) Calm down! What are you talking about?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dixon, the rich man's son and ski bum, is yelling on the other end of the line.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...this guy who said he was from the Security Exchange Commission, whatever the hell that is, calls and wants to ask me about that stock I bought...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What'd you tell him?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I told him I was in the bathroom and I'd call him right back. What the hell was I supposed to say Buddy, you got me into...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look Dixon, calm down! It's not illegal to buy stock or to be right. And it's not all that unusual to be spot checked on a big buy. Tell him you did your homework and you thought the stock was a sound investment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What if he asks where I got the money?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tell 'em your father gave it to you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What if they call him?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They won't. That's not their jurisdiction.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You sure?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes! Read the Constitution, it's all in there. And remember--you don't know anything, nothing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know anything!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good. Then call him back. And call me back. Don't worry. He hangs up, a worried expression, Marv entering to break his concentration.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey you hear the news. I just got a job at a new firm: "Dewey, Cheat 'em and Howe." Yuk yuk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Didn't I tell you to knock before you came in here?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey the door was open.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then get out and close it behind you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know what you need, buddy buddy--an optorectomy. That's when they cut the nerve that runs from your brain to your rectum--to change that shitty attitude of yours.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get the hell out! Marv slams the door on his way...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Long shot of the towering stone structure. A tall angular figure crosses through the glass doors with a bulky folder under his arm...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The man flashes his ID to a SECURITY GUARD who buzzes him through the gate... He walks towards us and we see he is the familiar tall, baby-faced INVESTIGATOR from the S.E.C. Options Watch Office... he gets in an elevator.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .E.C. INVESTIGATION OFFICES - DAY He walks into the office of a CHIEF INVESTIGATOR. A balding sharp-featured man in a drab suit with bags of hard work under his eyes looks up as the young investigator places the large file in front of him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bud enters, preoccupied. Barnes is nervous.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So what's the problem?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...got a strange call from the SEC. They asked to see my records... Bud, this is a heavy...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ....Relax Roget (French pronunciation) You're 82M in the account numbers and I'm the Invisible Man... they're always looking for red flags, Gekko's always getting checked by them, they never come up with anything... we're invulnerable on this...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Alright... I just wanna slow down Bud... no more calls for awhile, no lunches... we suspend our business, alright...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sure Roger, whatever you want, it's cool. A young lawyer pops his head in the room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rog, come on, bring the cost report. They started. (exits)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gekko asked us into the Bluestar deal. We're reviewing the timetables, wanna come?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He never told me...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're just the President of the company, what do you know? ... Come on. As they walk out.
direction.name: direction

result.heading: THREE LAWYERS, TWO INVESTMENT BANKERS, THREE COMMERCIAL BANKERS,

direction.raw_text: Smoky, coffee cups and food. THREE LAWYERS, TWO INVESTMENT BANKERS, THREE COMMERCIAL BANKERS, sleeves rolled up, ties askew. A blackboard with Bluestar's assets diagrammed. A combat mood in the room. Bud walking in, feels vaguely worried, something is not quite right.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You guys know the new chief of Bluestar... Bud Fox. They nod vaguely respectful but Bud's obviously a figure head to them, takes a seat off to the side. The bull-like
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Vietnam vet, in shirt and suspenders, is on the attack against the stuffier Commercial Bankers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look guys, what's the problem, let's for the kill...Gekko's got
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: % and climbing plus the unions are in his pocket for now, everybody on the street knows the stock's in play (overlapping voice: up 2 1/4 since the open) by next week the street's gonna own Bluestar and management won't be able to do anything but poison their own pill. Why are you guys dicking around? Is the bank financing in place or are we gonna have more and more meetings? Our firm's gonna guarantee 25% of the total debt structure in long-term junk bonds, now you guys either sign this piece of paper right now or we're gonna pull and head for another bank for the 75...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...look, we have 30 banks ready to participate in a 4 year revolving credit line but we have to have your assurance to pay back most of the loan in the first 6 months, and the only way...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... 30 banks, isn't that wonderful...you got it, no problem.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...and the only way we can see this happening is liquidating the hangars and the planes. Can you people guarantee that? Bud freezes where he sits...it all comes crashing down in a milli-second on that word "liquidate" -- shock now spreading on Bud's face...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Guaranteed! No sweat...we already got the Bleezburg brothers lined up to build condos where the hangars are, we can lay off the planes with Mexicana, who are dumb enough to buy 'em and Texas Air is drooling at my kneecaps to get the slots and the routes. What's the problem? it's done..
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is the pricetag on the 737s, the gates, the hangars, the routes, we got it all nailed right down to the typewriters... Bud sits there numbly, a sickening feeling taking hold of him as the camera and music track and trap him tighter and tighter. The lawyers' voices distorting in the background.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...'course the beauty of it is the overfunded pension fund. Gekko gets the 75 million in there. Fifty million buys him the minimum annuities for 6,000 employees and he walks away with the rest. All in, he'll net 60 to 70 million. Not bad for a month's work. (to Bud) Your man did his homework, Fox, you're gonna have the shortest executive career since the Pope who got poisoned...now he'll really start believing he's "Gekko the Great."
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (passing a paper to the commercial banker)
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Bud walks intently past the receptionist and down the long white marble hall.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Natalie is on the phone. Bud marches past her desk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, he wants to change that appointment to... (cupping the receiver) Bud--you can't go in there. He's in a meeting! He ignores her and throws open Gekko's door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gekko is talking with the LAWYERS and BANKERS from the Bluestar deal, as Bud barges in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I didn't know we had a meeting schedule for this morning.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sorry, this can't wait. Gekko stares at him with piercing eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Will you gentlemen excuse us for a few minutes? The lawyers and bankers get up and discreetly leave the room. Gekko waits for them to go, turns back to Bud.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What the hell do you want?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I found out about the garage sale down at Bluestar. Why? Gekko is taken by surprise.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Last night I read Rudy the story of Winnie the Pooh and the Honey pot. Know what happened: he stuck his nose in that honey pot once too often and got stung.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maybe you ought to read him Pinocchio. You told me you were going to turn Bluestar around. Not upside down. You used me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're walking around blind without a cane, sport. A fool and his money are lucky to get together in the first place.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why do you need to wreck this company?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Because it's wreckable. I took another look and I changed my mind.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If these people lose their jobs, nowhere to go. My father worked at Bluestar for twenty-four years. I gave 'em my word.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's all about bucks, kid, the rest is conversation... (loosening) Bud, you're still going to be president. And when the time comes, you'll parachute out a rich man. With the money you're going to make, your father won't have to work another day in his life.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tell me, Gordon--when does it all end? How many yachts can you waterski behind? How much is enough?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Buddy, it's not a question of enough. It's a zero sum game, sport. Somebody wins and somebody loses. Money itself isn't lost or made, it's simply transferred from one perception to another. Like magic. That painting cost $60,000 10 years ago. I could sell it today for $600,000. The illusion has become real. And the more real it becomes, the more desperately they want it. Capitalism at its finest.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How much is enough Gordon?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The richest one percent of this country owns half the country's wealth: 5 trillion dollars. One third of that comes from hard work, two thirds of it comes from inheritance, interest on interest accumulation to widows and idiot sons and what I do -- stock and real estate speculation. It's bullshit. Ninety percent of the American people have little or no net worth. I create nothing; I own. We make the rules, Buddy, the news, war, peace, famine, upheaval; the cost of a paper clip. (picking one up) We pull the rabbit out of the hat while everybody else sits around their whole life wondering how we did it... (crosses to Bud) ...you're not naive enough to think we're living in a democracy are you, Buddy? It's the free market. You're one of us now...take advantage of it. You got the killer instinct, kid, stick with me. I got things to teach you...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Obviously... As he puts his arm around Bud, leading him to the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Believe me, Buddy, I was gonna discuss this with you at the right time. Look, why don't you calm down and come to the apartment for dinner tonight. Bring Darien...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...I can't make it tonight.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you with me Buddy? At the door, a look of unmistakable power...and danger.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I want you with me. (waits)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm with you Gordon... He walks out the door, the misery he is in washing his brow.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...be another minute, Natalie. As he crosses back to the coffee table and punches up a phone number.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is Gordon Gekko. Now... (a beat, with controlled rage) I want zip-locked mouths on Bluestar, or I'm gonna personally come down there and rip out your fucking throats!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bud walks out, heading up the street, absent amid the scurrying mid-day hordes tearing up the street for the loot inside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Darien approaches, carrying groceries, enters the building.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bud is slumped on the couch, a spent bottle of tequila in front of him. Outside the twilight is quickening into night, shadows, scurrying across the unlit room.... for the first time we see him sucking on a cigarette. Darien opens the door and freezes, surveying the living room. A broken vase on the carpet, a curtain ripped off a window, a painting upended, a chair overturned, selected but not frenzied damage...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bud?...What's going on? She puts down the grocery bags, frightened.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've been played like a grand- piano--by the master, Gekko the Great...and today was the big crash. Liquidation sale. He's gonna carve Bluestar into little pieces and sell it all off... Darien registering this, is picking up pieces of the broken vase.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sorry. I was afraid something like this could happen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Talk about being bent over the sink of life and being dry humped. I handed it to him on a silver platter. I told my father and those people...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Buddy, it's not your fault, and it's not your decision.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm not gonna let it happen Darien. She stops, lights a cigarette, growing concern.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't cross Gordon. He'll crush you. You've worked hard to get where you are. If Gordon doesn't buy Bluestar someone else will; and who's to say they won't do the same thing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: At least I wouldn't be pulling the trigger. She sighs...comes over, tries to shake some sense into him!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you mad! Why are you doing this! We're so close, the town is going to be ours. Don't throw away your future Bud!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can stay with the brokerage firm. And you're doing fine. We can survive without Gordon Gekko.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm not looking to just survive. I've been doing that all my life.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What the hell's that supposed to mean? Darien moves out from his approximate circle, wrestling with what she wants to say...until she turns and says it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That if you make an enemy of Gordon Gekko, I won't be there to stand by you. Bud is stunned...and hurt.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You really mean that? (lashing out) What'd he promise you? To take you public? I guess without Gordon's money and seal of approval, I'm not such a hot investment anymore. You're just the best money can buy, Darien...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're not exactly pure Bud, you went after Gekko with the same vengeance you went after me. Look in the mirror before...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm looking...and I sure don't like what I see. She collects her things and walks to the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fair enough...but it's not that simple, Bud. When I was down and had nothing, it was Gordon who helped me. He got me all my clients -- you among them... (snaps her fingers) and he can take it away like that. (a beat) You may find out one day -- that when you've had money and lost it, it's worse than never having had it at all. Bud steps across to her in a rage.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's bullshit! Step out that door, I'm changing the locks. She opens the door saddened.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You may not believe this Bud but I really do care for you. I think we could've made a good team...but that's how it goes...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get the hell out! She does. Bud stares at the closed door, mute, numb, totally devastated.... the loss is not just Darien, it is total... He looks at his face in the reflection of a wall mirror...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Waiting for the elevator. Darien also looks at herself a beat in the hall mirror. She's crying. Then she steels herself and enters the elevator.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The same realtor, SYLVIe DRIMMER, who sold him the place, is back. The phone is ringing, unanswered...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...well, the market's dead, hon, even the rich are bitching, nothing's moving except termites and cockroaches, and with my commission being what it is...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Save the rap, just sell it -- fast! He's in his socks, unshaven, smoking, he looks like he's been on a bender for the weekend. The phone stops ringing. He turns and walks into the bedroom, slamming the door behind him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bud walks in, a different, more serious look in his eye, purposeful. Past CAROLYN and JANET at the outer desk. They stop what they're doing and look up at him surprised.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bud! Where you been the last two days?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...Janet get my father on the phone and the two other union reps, urgent... He notices her face, something's wrong.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your mom just called, Mr. Fox. Your father... he...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What! What happened?!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He had a heart attack, hon, but he's okay, he's at the hospital...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh Christ! INT. BUD'S BMW - DAY Bud weaving fast through traffic.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bud races past the nurses' desks and down the hallway.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bud's MOTHER is outside with Dominick Amato and another neighbor just visiting, bringing candies.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mom! How is he?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...he was complaining about chest pains at work. Next thing I know he collapsed... Oh Buddy, talk to him, he's so stubborn.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...don't worry, he's got another 20 years in him. He's a tough ol' nut, your Dad...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The blinds are drawn. His Dad lies there, tubes down his nose, hooked up to an IV unit and monitors. Bud comes over. Carl, glassy-eyed, significantly frailer, nods to him. It's obvious that more damage was done than Bud expected. Mom comes into the room with him, stands there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hiya Dad... (sits, smiles) What was it? Mom talked too much or was it her spaghetti? I mean pasta... (Mom bringing a handkerchief to her eyes) I told you never to lift a 747 by yourself... Carl, smiles weakly, on pain killers. Bud pulls out a cigarette. He fumbles with it before putting it away, trying to keep a gruff tone between them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...you even got me smoking now...second one Dad, you're pushing your luck, I guess you know that...I guess you gotta pull through this one Dad...for mom, for me...I guess I never told you but...I love you Dad, I love you more than I ever. (begins to weep) ...I didn't mean those things I said to you...you're a hero all the way Dad, you're a rock...the best. The words seem to come flowing out of Bud as Carl's eyes fill with tears.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...and you were right about Gekko. He's one son of a bitch...through and through. Carl stares at him, beginning to understand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's gonna break up Bluestar. Carl reacts violently in his eyes but Bud soothes him...in dead earnest, trying to be deliberate and clear in his meaning.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...but I gotta plan Dad, it can work, I can save the airline, I know you got no reason to believe me but I want you to trust me...I need to talk to the unions...Can I speak for you? Carl's eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your words, not mine...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You speak for me, son.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gekko and Darien are seated together in the back row. Darien looks serious and distracted in spite of all the excitement going on around her. It is the big spring Impressionist sale and all the major players, or their representatives are here. Gekko is bidding.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look over there sunshine. I'm up against Richard Feigen. He is on a roll, electric. As the price mounts and surpasses the two million dollar mark, Gekko rises and walks down the side aisle to the front, never taking his eyes away from the auctioneer. He stands agressively, arms akimbo, in a nose to nose confrontation.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Once, twice, three times. Sold to Mr. Gordon Gekko.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They walk the sunny streets, a jubilant Gekko, savoring his triumph, grabs Darien's arm.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you say we go get a suite at the Carlyle? Caviar? Champagne? Celebrate, just like the old times Sunshine.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Those days are over, Gordon. They were over a long time ago.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can't blame me for trying. You look as beautiful as that painting I just bought. He pats her on the back in a preprietary fashion.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So what's the problem Sunshine? You look like Black Thursday. Bad case of puppy love?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's not puppy love, Gordon. Anyway, Buddy and I are splitting up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sorry to hear that. I thought the kid had staying power.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's over you, Gordon.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You told him about us?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, are you crazy? And I don't want him ever to know. Do you understand?... She moves closed and takes Gordon's hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I want to ask you a big favor, Gordon. Please drop the Bluestar deal.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now tell me, why would I want to do that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Because I don't want to see him hurt.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't worry Sunshine. Bud and I had a little talk. We came to an understanding. (takes her hand paternally) I want you to go back to him. Soothe him. Help keep his head straight. Okay?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can't...and I won't.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come on, we both like Buddy. But this bleeding heart puppy love act is over the top... It doesn't fit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maybe it does. Don't patronize me Gordon.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You and I are the same, Darien. We're smart enough not to buy into the oldest myth running: love... A fiction created by people who got nothing to keep them from jumping out of windows.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're really twisted, Gordon. You're incapable of giving to anybody because deep down inside you there's a poverty that every last dollar in the world won't fill.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ooh ooh, tough talk from a scared little girl all wrapped in a pretty grown-up package. Does this mean you're ready to cut the umbilical cord and step out into the world on your own? Because, Darien, if you're through with me, you're through with everything I'm a part of. Darien's eyes cloud over...the look of a scared child being banished by her father. Then...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know...but maybe, just maybe Gordon, I'm good enough so I don't need you anymore. She walks away.
direction.name: direction

location: STREET IN FRONT OF AUCTION HOUSE
result.heading: EXT.

dialogue.raw_text: (condescendingly but paying little attention to the rebuff)
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Bud is seated at a corner table with the BLUESTAR UNION REPS: Duncan Wilmore, ALPA LEADER and Toni Carpenter, AFA rep; also jointed by machinists, Dominick Amato and Charley Dent, sitting in for his father's union.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...the stock's at 19 1/4 and it's going up. Gekko figures by breaking up Bluestar, it's worth at least $30 a share. That means he'll buy up to 23 or 24 and still think he's making money.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How do you know that the stock is going to go up?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You really don't want to know any more than that, Mr. Wilmore. Let's just say I have some friends.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay. What happens then?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: When the stock hits 23, you guys go to Gekko and lower the boom. Once he learns he has no union concession, he's going to head for the hills. He'll sell everything he's got.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah. But who's going to buy then and what's to prevent another shark from coming along and devouring us?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bud, Duncan Wilmore, Toni Carpenter, Dominick and Charley, an unlikely looking group in the plushness of the apartment lobby.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We have an appointment to see Mr. Wildman.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lofty windows overlooking the Park, an impeccably-decorated apartment with coffee and rolls laid out, a young AIDE quietly moving around. Bud and the others are on sofas around the imposing figure of Wildman in a chair across.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sir Lawrence, what would you say to owning Bluestar Airlines with union concessions--at $18 a share...and in the process hanging Gordon Gekko out in the wind to twist.... ? Sir Lawrence leans back in his chair, equably...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I might be very interested, but why? Why you mate -- how'd you get mixed up with Gekko? He doesn't know the difference between raiding and insider trading. I do. The SEC does. I hope you do...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let's just say Mr. Gekko and I have a conflict of interest. I want to see this airline work... (pointing to the documents in front of Wildman) ...the figures here show it can.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... and you're prepared to take these large salary cuts.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...we are. But we want a contract agreement -- iron-clad -- that if you buy it, you can't break it up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm still listening...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bud hurries in, past Marv on the phone with an irate customer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, if that's how you feel--the hell with you too. And strong letter to follow. He slams the phone down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You don't have to agree with me, Marv; but I think I've been a bit of a schmuck lately. (beat, waits)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I agree. Go thou and sin no more.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I want to make it up to you. Bluestar, put all your clients in it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thanks, buddy, buddy, I'm back. Say, Buddy, those optorectomies do work wonders. Bud intersecting Lou Mannheim smoking a cigarette and having a hard time walking.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bluestar, Mr. Mannheim. Put all your clients in it. Davls looks gravely at Bud.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know where you get your information, son, but I don't like it. The only reason I'm gonna do it is...I need the money, that's the problem with money--it makes you do things you don't want to do. Bud hears him, walks on...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Miss Bloom, Marvin. You got cancer in your portfolio, but I got the cure...Bluestar Airlines...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bud on the phone, checking his quotron.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Listen I need a favor and it's a quick scalp for you. Two hundred thousand at 19 1/2; can you position it in one of your equity funds?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...call waiting on 7.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hold on... (switches over, hushed) ...listen "blue horseshoe loves Bluestar Airlines"... Immediately goes back to the other line.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The REPORTER, who Bud anonymously called on the earlier Anacott Steel buy, hangs up. He rises from his desk and crosses the busy news floor, over to his EDITOR.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bluestar's in play.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: dashes up to the BLUESTAR AIRLINES post, where a heated crowd is gathered, amidst heavy trading. He elbows his way over to a TRADER, handing him the ticket. The TRADER holds up the buy order, screaming, making frantic hand signals, in search of a seller. Faces in the crowd look up at the broad tape.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: S TO:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: , the stock quote flashing across the BROAD TAPE--upticking to 20 1/4.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Marv, on the phone pitching, eyes glued to the office TAPE-- as BST jumps to 21 1/4.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I love it...I do love it so!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The quotron now climbs to 22 1/8!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah. I see it at 22 1/8 and I don't know what to make of it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He paces on the other end of the phone, real anger showing; now Alex and Susan seen in b.g.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The word's out. Your union buddies are talking. Get me in at a 45 degree angle and I mean all the way in! Slash and burn, buy everything you can get up to 22. Then call me. When I get the sonofabitch who leaked this I'm gonna kill him! I'm gonna tear his eyeballs out, I'm gonna suck his skull!! As he glances at his quotron the stock ticks up another 1/8th.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All the BROKERS have jumped into the action, avidly watching Bluestar's stock climb on the BROAD TAPE. Bud sweeps into the room and looks up at the board as the stock hits 22 7/8.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The stock's going to Pluto!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Start unloading.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sell?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now! Tell everyone to dump! Marv nods, and rushes away. Bud crosses past Mannheim's office.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get out of Bluestar! In background Marv is spreading the word, brokers frantically grabbing phones, calling clients to sell.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gekko looks up from his quotron and shouts to his troops on the phones.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who the hell's out there? What are the arbs saying? It's gotta be a big hitter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They don't know what's going on!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Everybody and his mother is buying! Natalie enters the room, flustered.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mr. Gekko, there's a whole bach of people from Bluestar Airlines outside demanding to see you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What the hell do they want?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'd be happy to tell you. As Duncan, Toni Carpenter, Dominick Amato, Charley Dent and
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: other assorted UNION MEMBERS march into the room. Gekko is taken by surprise, but stays calm.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We know what you're up to, Gekko, and let me tell you this from here, (hits his heart) you suck eggs, mister, over my dead body you ain't gonna break up Bluestar.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You guys must know something nobody else knows. If those are my plans, it's the first I've heard of it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Would you care to put that in writing?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'd like to remind you we already have an agreement, which I expect you to honor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well in that case, I hope you have your pilot's license.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't worry, Gekko, we wouldn't let the engines fall out of the plane.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But the reservations systems can get awfully screwed up, if we're not paying attention.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And a lot of baggage headed to St. Petersburg could easily find its way to Pittsburgh.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Listen, you clowns, there's somebody else out there trying to buy your airline, if you want to be Pac-manned and gobbled by Atilla the Hun be my guest!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We'll take our chances. (tips his hat) Nice to see you again, Mr. Gekko. They file out of the room. The phone lines have lit up like a Christmas tree. Alex answers a call.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fox says Bluestar just hit 23. What do you want him to do?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sell it all. (then, evenly) What the hell, so I'll only make ten million.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bud switches lines from Gekko to Larry Wildman.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gekko's on the ropes--he's trying to sell, but there's not many takers, the stock's plummeting.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wildman is off the Long Island Sound waters in his boat lighting a cigar. Two beautiful women and an aide are with him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well then... guess I'll have to carry him a few rounds before he drops. Switches lines, checking his quotron...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bluestar. Don't make a big deal. Buy it lightly on the way down. (emphatically) When it hits 18--buy it all.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wildman's broker takes the order with a curt "got it" and dashes out of the cubicle over to the Bluestar post where a chaotic crowd is gathered, traders frantically screaming to sell Bluestar shares. He looks at the Big Board--sees an XTR drop to 17. When he raises his hand to buy, he is mobbed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Big Board...a series of snappy dissolves accompanied by lively music shows the stock price falling to 16 1/2 ...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Alex, Ollie, Susan on the phones.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The arbs are getting killed. Where'd the buyers go!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're being devoured, Gordon. Harold Salt, walking on egg shells, looks to Gekko, who sits with the phone receiver crooked to his neck.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's got to be a way out of this, Gordon.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, Harold, why don't you dial
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . (into the receiver) Fox, where the hell are you? I'm losing millions. (a beat) Look, you got me into this airline, and you damn well better get me out. Because if you don't the only job you're going to get on the Street is sweeping it! You hear me, Fox--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bud scribbling an order ticket, replies on the other end.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You once told me don't get emotional about stock. Gordon, don't. The bid is 17 and going down. As your broker, I advise you to take it. Bud moves the phone away from his ear, at Gekko's cursing, and signs the ticket.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gordon, it's two minutes to close. What do you want to do?! Decide.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dump it. Bud hangs up and rushes off with the ticket.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The 35" television is on to:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The big Wall Street story tonight is the  roller coaster ride of Bluestar Airlines. Fueled by takeover rumors, the stock soared to an all-time high of 24 1/8. Then when contradictory rumors later surfaced that the takeover was unfounded, buyers went running for cover, and the stock plummeted on gigantic volume to as low as 16 1/2 before closing at 17. Camera discovers Gekko sitting, grimly watching the report. Rudy seen riding his toy car in background.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...but then tonight, amidst all the scuttlebutt, another rumble shook (a beat) According to many sources, raider Sir Lawrence Wildman has stepped in and bought a substantial block of Bluestar and is going to announce a deal tomorrow at 18 that includes the support of the unions. Camera now tracks in close on Gekko as he absorbs the unexpected blow. O.S. Rudy yelling and squealing. Gekko leans back, putting the pieces together, his eyes narrowing into burning slits. He smashes the glass cocktail table with a massive paperweight as Kate hears it, shocked.
direction.name: direction

result.heading: "SIR LAWRENCE WILDMAN MOUNTS BLUESTAR BUY WITH UNION SUPPORT"

direction.raw_text: People rushing to work. Bud crosses the street, his face buried in The Financial Times. Insert: "SIR LAWRENCE WILDMAN MOUNTS BLUESTAR BUY WITH UNION SUPPORT". Satisfied, Bud folds the paper and heads into his office building.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He walks past Carolyn the receptionist who is strangely mute...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Smile, Carolyn, there's justice in the world...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He passes the CHINESE STOCKLADY. She sees him and manages to look away. Marvin exchanges a look with him but can't bring himself to talk. Bud wonders...the whole office seems silent, the other BROKERS stealing glances. ...as he passes Lou Mannheim with Charlie Cushing, who ignores Bud...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How's it going Mr. Mannheim? Got out of Bluestar in time I hope? Mannheim stops, winds up. Bud impatient but polite.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bud I like you, just remember something. Man looks in the abyss, there's nothing staring back at him. At that time a man finds his character--and that is what keeps him out of the abyss... (a beat, looks deeply)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think I understand what you mean Mr. Mannheim. But not really. As, on this increasingly strange morning, he moves on past Janet who wants to tell his something but he cuts her off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get my father will you Janet?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As Bud walks in, the camera glides to reveal the young SEC INVESTIGATOR, who has been tracking Buddy, going through his files. A SECOND MAN, PATTERSON, is standing behind the desk using the phone as a bored-looking 3RD MAN and POLICEMAN stand off to the side with Hieronymus Lynch, who gives Bud a withering glance.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He just came in. I'll talk to you later. On Bud--a struck-dumb look passing to resignation, as if for a long time now, he has been expecting this.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I guess you're not here to open an
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mr Fox, I'm Henry Patterson from the Postal Inspection Service... this is Evan Morrissey with The Securities and Exchange Investigation Office. (presents his ID and indicates MAN 3) ... Mr. Ebanhopper from the US Attorney's Office.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mr. Fox, you're under arrest for conspiracy to commit securities fraud and for violating the Insider Trader's Sanction Act. The handcuffs come out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Long shot. Activity is winding down, a few sunbathers collecting their blankets. A solitary figure stands on a hill silhouetted by the sunset. A second figure appears on a footpath and starts climbing the hill towards the other man. Gekko waits, expressionless... Bud approaches him. They stand facing each other.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hello Bud.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gordon.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You sandbagged me on Bluestar. (smiles) I guess you think you taught the teacher a lesson, that you can make the tail wag the dog, huh? Bud looks away. Gekko's smile fades.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well let me cue you in: the ice is melting under your feet sport... Without warning, he grabs Buddy roughly by the lapels and lets out his inner rage with a series of smacks and slaps across his face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You think you could've gotten this far this fast with anybody else? You think you could be out there dicking somebody like Darien? No, you'd be cold calling dentists and widows to buy twenty shares of some dog stock! I took you in! A nobody! I opened doors for you!...I showed you how the system works!... Gekko slapping him harder and harder, Buddy staggering with the blows, saying nothing, not defending himself.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...the value of information! How you get it! Anacott Steel, Brant Resources, Transuniversal, Fulham Oil. And this is how you pay back, you cockroach! I gave you Darien, I gave you your manhood. I gave you everything. He backhands Bud across the face. Bud lies on the ground, spent, as is Gordon breathing hard. Bud gets to his knees, blood streaming from his nose, his suit muddied. Passersby look on, wondering. Gekko seems to relent, the rage going into hurt, remorse. He hands Bud a handkerchief. Bud staunches the flow of blood from his nose.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You could've been one of the great ones Bud...I look at you and see myself...Why? Bud looks at Gordon, torn by mixed emotions: the bonds they share and the betrayal wrought.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know. My Dad once told me, "money is something you need in case you don't die tomortow." I guess I realized I'm just Bud Fox. And as much as I wanted to be Gordon Gekko--I'll always be Bud Fox. He looks at Gordon, as if wanting to say more, but doesn't. In long shot, Gordon stands alone as Bud walks away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The DOORMAN looks askance. Bud, mud-splattered suit and bloody nose, walks straight past him thru the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Several well-heeled DINERS look up from their haute cuisine, at the sight of Bud making his way toward the men's room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tight on Bud, staring at his reflection in the mirror, as he unbuttons his shirt, revealing adhesive tape swathed across his chest. Camera paces back as he winces when...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: and AGOSTINI, the two investigators, rip the tape off his chest, retrieving a small tape recorder. Morrissey of the S.E.C. rewinds the cassette. We hear Gekko's voice being played back on the tape, the mention of their deals.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You did the right thing, Bud. Bud looks searchingly in the mirror. Faint CLICKING NOISE comes up over the shot.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: of the Broad Tape grows LOUDER. Shots of Lou Mannheim, Lynch, Marv; silently looking up at the green fluorescent print-out.
direction.name: direction

result.heading: ATTORNEY'S OFFICE TODAY ANNOUNCED CRIMINAL CHARGES AGAINST CORPORATE RAIDER GORDON GEKKO AND STOCK BROKER BUD FOX, FOR CONSPIRACY TO COMMIT SECURITIES FRAUD, TAX EVASION, VIOLATIONS OF SECURITY ACTS, AND MAIL FRAUD

direction.raw_text: .S. ATTORNEY'S OFFICE TODAY ANNOUNCED CRIMINAL CHARGES AGAINST CORPORATE RAIDER GORDON GEKKO AND STOCK BROKER BUD FOX, FOR CONSPIRACY TO COMMIT SECURITIES FRAUD, TAX EVASION, VIOLATIONS OF SECURITY ACTS, AND MAIL FRAUD...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Carl, dressed in a suit and tie, sits at the dining table, finished breakfast plates in front of him, refilling his coffee cup. Mom clearing off the table, anxious... As Bud walks in, wearing a suit and tie. He looks tired, beaten, the eyes lifeless, in a dark mood.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...don't wear that tie Buddy, it... She cuts off on Bud's look.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Another cup of coffee?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, thanks, I'm nervous enough.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I guess it's time to hit the road.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, don't want to be late for my own funeral.
direction.name: direction
